metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from the Shenshawo sandy desert station eddy covariance system (EC) in the flux observation matrix from 1 June to 15 September, 2012. The site (100.49330° E, 38.78917° N) was located in a sandy desert surface, which is near Zhangye, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1594.00 m. The EC was installed at a height of 4.6 m; the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (CSAT3&Li7500) was 0.15 m.
Raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Edire post-processing software (University of Edinburgh, http://www.geos.ed.ac.uk/abs/research/micromet/EdiRe/), including spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. Moreover, the observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC), which was proposed by Foken and Wichura [1996]: class 1 (level 0: Δst<30 and ITC<30), class 2 (level 1: Δst<100 and ITC<100), and class 3 (level 2: Δst>100 and ITC>100), representing high-, medium-, and low-quality data, respectively. In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 3% of the 30 min raw record; and (4) data were rejected at night when the friction velocity (u*) was less than 0.1 m/s. There were 48 records per day; the missing data were replaced with -6999. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m^3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m^3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m^2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m^2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m^2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xlsx format.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2016) (for multi-scale observation experiment or sites information), Xu et al. (2013) (for data processing) in the Citation section.

该数据集包含了2012年6月1日至9月15日的通量观测矩阵中神沙窝站涡动相关通量观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市，下垫面是沙漠。观测点的经纬度是100.49330E, 38.78917N，海拔1594.00m。涡动相关仪架高4.6m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速仪与CO2/H2O分析仪之间的距离是15cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Edire软件后处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Edire软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据每30min内缺失率大于3%的数据；（4）剔除夜间弱湍流的观测数据（u*小于0.1m/s）。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。因仪器漂移等原因引起的可疑数据用红色字体标识。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），稳定度Z/L（无量纲），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为三级（质量标识0:（Δst <30, ITC<30）; 1: （Δst <100, ITC<100）; 其余为2）。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
多尺度观测试验或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2016)，观测数据处理请参考Xu et al.(2013)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在能量平衡闭合不完整的情况下，EC通量测量的H和LE与可用能量Rn−G0之间存在差异。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散量（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组分温度作为输入，估算蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散发（ET），并随后通过稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡度相关法（EC）测量的结合，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）来计算。土壤和冠层的组件温度是通过热像仪获取的图像计算得出的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个涡度（EC）塔和四个双层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

Comparison.AnswerEn: In irrigated agricultural areas, challenges in estimating surface fluxes with the TSEB model include dealing with strongly advective conditions and incomplete energy balance closure, which complicate accurate flux estimation. In desert environments, the challenges might differ, focusing on issues such as heterogeneous surfaces and varying land cover types, which affect the ability to accurately separate soil and canopy temperatures and resistances, crucial for reliable flux estimation using the TSEB model.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在灌溉农业区，使用TSEB模型估算表面通量面临的挑战包括处理强烈的平流条件和能量平衡闭合不完全，这使得准确的通量估算变得复杂。在沙漠环境中，挑战可能有所不同，主要集中在异质表面和不同土地覆盖类型的问题上，这影响了准确分离土壤和冠层温度及阻力的能力，而这些对于使用TSEB模型进行可靠的通量估算至关重要。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the multiscale observation framework help in understanding the eco-hydrological processes over heterogeneous surfaces?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测框架如何帮助理解异质表面上的生态水文过程？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The multiscale observation framework captures eco-hydrological processes by using a hierarchically nested scale approach, as demonstrated in the HiWATER experiment. This involves a diverse array of instruments, such as eddy covariance towers and remote sensing tools, strategically placed to gather data across different landscapes. Such a design allows for a comprehensive understanding of the interactions between different surface types, like oasis and desert, by providing multidisciplinary data that enhance the understanding of processes across scales.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测框架通过采用层次嵌套的尺度方法来捕捉生态水文过程，正如HiWATER实验所示。这涉及到一系列多样化的仪器，如涡度协方差塔和遥感工具，战略性地布置在不同的景观中，以收集跨不同景观的数据。这种设计使得对不同表面类型（如绿洲和沙漠）之间相互作用的全面理解成为可能，通过提供多学科的数据来增强对跨尺度过程的理解。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective environments, and how can technological advancements address these challenges?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在强对流环境中，准确估计表面通量面临哪些挑战，以及技术进步如何解决这些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: In strongly advective environments, accurately estimating surface fluxes is challenging due to incomplete energy balance closure and the dominance of surface-air temperature differences. Technological advancements, such as improved thermal imaging and refined models like the TSEB, can address these challenges by providing more accurate component temperature estimations and better separating soil and vegetation fluxes. The use of high-precision thermal cameras and improved radiometric temperature models can mitigate errors and improve the reliability of flux estimates.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在强对流环境中，由于能量平衡闭合不完全和表面与空气温度差异的主导作用，准确估计表面通量是具有挑战性的。技术进步，如改进的热成像技术和精细化的模型（如TSEB），可以通过提供更准确的组分温度估计和更好地分离土壤与植被通量来解决这些挑战。使用高精度热像仪和改进的辐射温度模型可以减小误差，提高通量估计的可靠性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a challenge in deriving accurate component temperatures for evapotranspiration models in arid regions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，推导蒸散发模型中准确的组分温度存在挑战的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in derived component temperatures are primarily caused by image classification errors, which can vary with vegetation abundance. In arid regions, soil pixels might be incorrectly classified as vegetation pixels, resulting in overestimation of canopy temperature. Moreover, not accounting for atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could contribute to uncertainties in estimated temperatures.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 衍生组件温度的误差主要是由图像分类错误引起的，这些错误可能会随着植被丰度的变化而变化。在干旱地区，土壤像素可能被错误地分类为植被像素，从而导致对树冠温度的高估。此外，未考虑大气向上辐射和透射率也可能导致估计温度的不确定性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors hinder the progress in upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 哪些因素阻碍了在异质表面上生态水文过程的升级进展？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The progress in upscaling eco-hydrological processes is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. The complex nature of capturing data across different scales and disciplines poses a significant challenge in obtaining comprehensive data necessary for upscaling these processes effectively.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 生态水文过程的上升进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的阻碍。跨不同尺度和学科捕捉数据的复杂性对有效获取必要的综合数据构成了重大挑战。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the implications of using an eddy covariance system with incomplete energy balance closure for estimating surface fluxes in an irrigated agricultural area?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在灌溉农业区域使用能量平衡闭合不完全的涡度协方差系统来估计表面通量的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using an eddy covariance system with incomplete energy balance closure can lead to uncertainties in estimating surface fluxes, such as sensible and latent heat. In strongly advective environments, this might result in discrepancies between modeled and measured fluxes, affecting the reliability of flux estimations. Calibration with stable isotope techniques and improved component temperature measurements can help mitigate these issues and enhance the accuracy of flux estimates.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用涡动协方差系统时，如果能量平衡闭合不完全，可能会导致在估算表面通量（如显热和潜热）时出现不确定性。在强对流环境中，这可能导致模型与测量通量之间的差异，从而影响通量估算的可靠性。通过稳定同位素技术进行校准以及改进组分温度测量可以帮助减轻这些问题，提高通量估算的准确性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to develop a multiscale dataset for observing eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中观察生态水文过程，开发多尺度数据集的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal of developing a multiscale dataset is to overcome the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations, which hinders progress in upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces. HiWATER is an experiment designed to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes in an oasis-desert area.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 开发多尺度数据集的目标是克服多尺度观测稀缺的挑战，这阻碍了对异质表面生态水文过程的上尺度研究。HiWATER实验旨在通过在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，获取多尺度和多学科的数据，以捕捉绿洲-沙漠地区的多尺度生态水文过程。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it necessary to use ground-based measurements and high-resolution thermal imaging in the partitioning of evapotranspiration into soil evaporation and transpiration?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在将蒸散发分为土壤蒸发和植物蒸腾时，有必要使用地面测量和高分辨率热成像？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Using ground-based measurements and high-resolution thermal imaging is necessary to accurately partition evapotranspiration into soil evaporation and transpiration. This approach allows for better validation of the model estimates using observed ratios of evaporation and transpiration, and helps address the challenge of accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective environments, thus improving the reliability of the TSEB model.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 使用地面测量和高分辨率热成像是准确划分蒸散发为土壤蒸发和植物蒸腾所必需的。这种方法允许通过观察到的蒸发和蒸腾比率更好地验证模型估计，并有助于解决在强对流环境中准确估计表面通量的挑战，从而提高TSEB模型的可靠性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are used to ensure the quality and accuracy of the eddy covariance flux measurements in heterogeneous desert environments?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在异质沙漠环境中，确保涡度协方差通量测量的质量和准确性使用了哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The procedures involve several post-processing steps using Edire software, including outlier removal, time delay correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, sonic virtual temperature correction, and density correction. Quality evaluation of flux values is performed based on atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity characteristics. Additionally, data filtering includes the removal of erroneous instrument data, exclusion of data around precipitation events, and the rejection of data with high missing rates or weak nighttime turbulence.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 这些程序涉及使用 Edire 软件进行多个后处理步骤，包括异常值去除、时间延迟校正、坐标旋转、频率响应校正、声学虚温校正和密度校正。基于大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征对通量值进行质量评估。此外，数据过滤包括去除错误的仪器数据、排除降水事件周围的数据，以及拒绝缺失率高或夜间湍流弱的数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What instruments and methodologies are implemented to conduct multi-scale eco-hydrological observations in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，实施多尺度生态水文观测的工具和方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The observation system includes a hierarchically nested setup with a sparse network of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations. This setup captures multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. Instruments include a superstation within the oasis, EC towers, two-layer automatic meteorological stations in surrounding landscapes, and intensive observation at the irrigation district scale. Airborne remote sensing missions are conducted using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer to obtain comprehensive data across scales.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 观测系统包括一个层次嵌套的设置，配备稀疏的涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站。该设置捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。仪器包括位于绿洲内的超级站、涡度协方差塔、周边景观中的双层自动气象站，以及在灌溉区尺度上的密集观测。使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计进行空中遥感任务，以获取跨尺度的综合数据。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What instrumentation advancements enable the acquisition of multiscale eco-hydrological data in heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些仪器进展使得在异质景观中获取多尺度生态水文数据成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of a hierarchically nested instrumentation system, which includes eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations, allows for the capture of multiscale eco-hydrological processes. Additionally, hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing tools such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer are employed to enhance data collection across various scales.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 使用分层嵌套的仪器系统，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站，可以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。此外，采用超高分辨率的航空遥感工具，如激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，以增强各个尺度的数据收集。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do technological developments in remote sensing facilitate the accurate estimation of evapotranspiration components in complex terrains?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 遥感技术的发展如何促进在复杂地形中准确估算蒸散发组成部分？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Technological developments such as high-resolution thermal infrared cameras and multi-angle thermal imagers enable the estimation of soil and canopy component temperatures. This, in turn, aids in the accurate calculation of evapotranspiration components using models like the two-source energy balance model, especially in strongly advective agricultural areas.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 技术发展，如高分辨率热红外相机和多角度热成像仪，使得能够估算土壤和冠层成分的温度。这反过来又有助于使用像双源能量平衡模型这样的模型准确计算蒸散发成分，特别是在强烈的平流农业区域。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methods are applied to ensure the quality and reliability of multiscale observational data in eco-hydrological research?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，确保多尺度观测数据质量和可靠性的方法有哪些？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Quality control measures in sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and dataset generation are crucial for ensuring the reliability of multiscale observational data. These methods are applied throughout the process to maintain data integrity in eco-hydrological research.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成中的质量控制措施对于确保多尺度观测数据的可靠性至关重要。这些方法贯穿整个过程，以维护生态水文研究中的数据完整性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might it be expected that multiscale observations are challenging to obtain in eco-hydrological studies over heterogeneous surfaces?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，获取多尺度观测数据在异质表面上可能会面临挑战的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Progress in upscaling eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations, which is a challenge addressed by the HiWATER experiment through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在异质表面上对生态水文过程进行上尺度化的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的阻碍，而HiWATER实验通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置来应对这一挑战。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why could the separation of soil and vegetation component temperatures be crucial for accurate evapotranspiration estimates in strongly advective irrigated agricultural regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 土壤和植被组件温度的分离对于在强烈的平流灌溉农业地区准确估算蒸散发可能至关重要，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in such regions is challenging due to the dominance of errors in determining component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature, affecting the performance of the TSEB model. A robust calculation of these temperatures is crucial for estimating E, T, and ET accurately.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在这些区域，准确估计表面通量是具有挑战性的，因为从表面复合辐射温度中确定组分温度的误差占主导地位，这影响了TSEB模型的性能。准确计算这些温度对于准确估计蒸散发（E）、温度（T）和蒸散发总量（ET）至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you assess the potential of using multi-scale observation datasets to improve the accuracy of eco-hydrological models in oasis-desert environments?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您如何评估使用多尺度观测数据集来提高绿洲-沙漠环境中生态水文模型准确性的潜力？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Multi-scale observation datasets have significant potential to enhance the accuracy of eco-hydrological models in oasis-desert environments. The availability of hierarchically nested data from various scales and instruments allows for a more comprehensive understanding of eco-hydrological processes and interactions. This approach can address the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations and provide valuable insights for model refinement.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测数据集在绿洲-沙漠环境中具有显著的潜力，可以提高生态水文模型的准确性。来自不同尺度和仪器的分层嵌套数据的可用性，使我们能够更全面地理解生态水文过程和相互作用。这种方法可以解决多尺度观测数据稀缺的问题，并为模型的改进提供有价值的见解。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how the challenges of measuring evaporation and transpiration are addressed in environments with strongly advective conditions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在强对流条件下，如何解决测量蒸发和蒸腾的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: In challenging environments with strong advection, the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model is used to estimate evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration. The model uses ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures and is validated with observed ratios of evaporation and transpiration using stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes and eddy covariance measurements. This approach helps address the uncertainties in surface-air temperature differences that affect the model's performance.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在强对流的挑战性环境中，双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型用于估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散。该模型使用地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度，并通过稳定氧和氢同位素以及涡度协方差测量验证蒸发和蒸腾的观测比率。这种方法有助于解决影响模型性能的表面与空气温度差异的不确定性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I am not clear on how the multiscale dataset from the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research is structured to improve the understanding of eco-hydrological processes.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不清楚来自黑河流域联合遥测实验研究的多尺度数据集是如何构建的，以提高对生态水文过程的理解。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The multiscale dataset from the Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) includes a variety of data sources such as a flux observation matrix, an eco-hydrological sensor network, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing. The data collection is organized through hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes, ensuring comprehensive coverage of the oasis-desert interaction.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 来自黑河流域联合遥感实验研究（HiWATER）的多尺度数据集包括多种数据源，如通量观测矩阵、生态水文传感器网络和超高分辨率航空遥感。数据收集通过层次嵌套的尺度组织，以捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，确保对绿洲-沙漠相互作用的全面覆盖。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please summarize the data collection methods employed for observing evapotranspiration and related meteorological parameters in heterogeneous landscapes.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 总结在异质景观中观察蒸散发和相关气象参数所采用的数据收集方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods include using eddy covariance systems for turbulent flux measurements, thermal infrared cameras for capturing soil and canopy temperatures, and hierarchical instrumentation for multiscale eco-hydrological data. Observations are complemented by airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, and microwave radiometers, as well as continuous hydrometeorological observations and sensor networks for soil moisture and vegetation dynamics.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统进行湍流通量测量，使用热红外相机捕捉土壤和树冠温度，以及使用分层仪器进行多尺度生态水文数据的收集。观测还通过使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪和微波辐射计的航空遥感进行补充，以及通过连续的气象水文观测和传感器网络监测土壤湿度和植被动态。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify the primary challenges faced in measuring and validating evapotranspiration in arid regions with heterogeneous surfaces.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 在异质表面的干旱地区，测量和验证蒸散发面临的主要挑战包括：
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Primary challenges include the complexity of accurately estimating surface fluxes in areas with incomplete energy balance closure, the difficulty in measuring ground-based E and T, and the uncertainties caused by image classification errors when deriving component temperatures. The strong advective environment and errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures also pose significant challenges.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 主要挑战包括在能量平衡闭合不完全的区域准确估计表面通量的复杂性、测量地面蒸散（E）和温度（T）的困难，以及在推导组成部分温度时由于图像分类错误而导致的不确定性。强烈的平流环境以及确定表层土壤和植被组成部分温度的错误也构成了重大挑战。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential strategies for enhancing dataset accuracy and reliability in heterogeneous land surface studies.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在异质陆地表面研究中增强数据集准确性和可靠性的潜在策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential strategies involve improving the separation of soil and canopy component temperatures using high-resolution thermal imagery and validating these temperatures against ground-based radiometric measurements. Quality control measures such as sensor calibration, data collection, processing, and dataset generation are crucial. Utilizing multiscale and multidisciplinary data from nested observational networks and airborne remote sensing missions can also enhance dataset accuracy.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的策略包括利用高分辨率热成像技术改善土壤和树冠组件温度的分离，并将这些温度与地面辐射测量进行验证。传感器校准、数据收集、处理和数据集生成等质量控制措施至关重要。利用来自嵌套观测网络和空中遥感任务的多尺度和多学科数据也可以提高数据集的准确性。
